component.name: tahu-edge
component.title: Tahu Edge Node / Device
component.description: Sparkplug B Edge Node and Device support over MQTT using Eclipse Tahu
component.label: messaging,iot,monitoring

checkClientIdLength.label: common
checkClientIdLength.description: MQTT client ID length check enabled

clientId.label: common
clientId.description: MQTT client ID to use for all server definitions, rather than specifying the same one for each. Note that if neither the 'clientId' parameter nor an 'MqttClientId' are defined for an MQTT Server, a random MQTT Client ID will be generated automatically, prefaced with 'Camel'

keepAliveTimeout.label: common
keepAliveTimeout.description: MQTT connection keep alive timeout, in seconds

rebirthDebounceDelay.label: common
rebirthDebounceDelay.description: Delay before recurring node rebirth messages will be sent

servers.label: common
servers.description: MQTT server definitions, given with the following syntax in a comma-separated list: MqttServerName:(MqttClientId:)(tcp/ssl)://hostname(:port),...

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

configuration.label: advanced
configuration.description: To use a shared Tahu configuration

sslContextParameters.label: security
sslContextParameters.description: SSL configuration for MQTT server connections

useGlobalSslContextParameters.label: security
useGlobalSslContextParameters.description: Enable/disable global SSL context parameters use

CamelTahuMessageType.description: The Sparkplug message type of the message

CamelTahuEdgeNodeDescriptor.description: The Sparkplug edge node descriptor string source of a message or metric

CamelTahuMessageTimestamp.description: The timestamp of a Sparkplug message

CamelTahuMessageUUID.description: The UUID of a Sparkplug message

CamelTahuMessageSequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of a Sparkplug message

deviceId.label: producer (device only)
deviceId.description: ID of this edge node device

checkClientIdLength.label: common
checkClientIdLength.description: MQTT client ID length check enabled

clientId.label: common
clientId.description: MQTT client ID to use for all server definitions, rather than specifying the same one for each. Note that if neither the 'clientId' parameter nor an 'MqttClientId' are defined for an MQTT Server, a random MQTT Client ID will be generated automatically, prefaced with 'Camel'

keepAliveTimeout.label: common
keepAliveTimeout.description: MQTT connection keep alive timeout, in seconds

rebirthDebounceDelay.label: common
rebirthDebounceDelay.description: Delay before recurring node rebirth messages will be sent

servers.label: common
servers.description: MQTT server definitions, given with the following syntax in a comma-separated list: MqttServerName:(MqttClientId:)(tcp/ssl)://hostname(:port),...

metricDataTypePayloadMap.label: producer
metricDataTypePayloadMap.description: Tahu SparkplugBPayloadMap to configure metric data types for this edge node or device. Note that this payload is used exclusively as a Sparkplug B spec-compliant configuration for all possible edge node or device metric names, aliases, and data types. This configuration is required to publish proper Sparkplug B NBIRTH and DBIRTH payloads.

headerFilterStrategy.label: producer,advanced
headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter headers used as Sparkplug metrics. Default value notice: Defaults to sending all Camel Message headers with name prefixes of CamelTahuMetric., including those with null values

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

bdSeqManager.label: producer (edge node only),advanced
bdSeqManager.description: To use a specific org.eclipse.tahu.message.BdSeqManager implementation to manage edge node birth-death sequence numbers

bdSeqNumPath.label: producer (edge node only),advanced
bdSeqNumPath.description: Path for Sparkplug B NBIRTH/NDEATH sequence number persistence files. This path will contain files named as -bdSeqNum and must be writable by the executing process' user

useAliases.label: producer (edge node only),advanced
useAliases.description: Flag enabling support for metric aliases

deviceIds.label: producer (edge node only)
deviceIds.description: ID of each device connected to this edge node, as a comma-separated list

primaryHostId.label: producer (edge node only)
primaryHostId.description: Host ID of the primary host application for this edge node

sslContextParameters.label: security
sslContextParameters.description: SSL configuration for MQTT server connections
